    • Extracting election data from spreadsheets

    Extracting election data from spreadsheets

    James Dunham, MIT MEDSL

    July 3, 2018

    excel.Rmd

    The problem

    Pretend it’s tabular?

    library(dplyr)
library(stringr)
library(readxl)
library(medslcleaner)

merrimack_path = spreadsheet_example('merrimack')
read_excel(merrimack_path, col_names = FALSE) %>%
  head()
    ## # A tibble: 6 x 8
##   ..1        ..2               ..3    ..4     ..5    ..6     ..7     ..8  
##   <chr>      <chr>             <chr>  <chr>   <chr>  <chr>   <chr>   <chr>
## 1 <NA>       State of New Ham… <NA>   <NA>    <NA>   <NA>    <NA>    <NA> 
## 2 <NA>       Merrimack County… <NA>   <NA>    <NA>   <NA>    <NA>    <NA> 
## 3 42682      Sheriff           <NA>   Attorn… <NA>   Treasu… <NA>    <NA> 
## 4 <NA>       Hilliard, r/d     Scatt… Murray… Scatt… Hammon… Rodrig… Scat…
## 5 Allenstown 2035              8      2013    3      1296    699     2    
## 6 Andover    1310              3      1277    <NA>   714     564     <NA>

    Alternative solution

    1. Identify which cells are data and which are headers
    2. Define the relationships between data cells and header cells

    Tools

    R packages:

    • tidyverse
    • tidyxl
    • unpivotr
    • medslcleaner

    Read the data

    library(medslcleaner)
library(tidyverse)
library(tidyxl)
library(unpivotr)

# For this example only: get path to the spreadsheet
merrimack_path = spreadsheet_example('merrimack')

cells = xlsx_cells(merrimack_path, sheet = 1)  # from tidyxl

    Representation in R

    cells %>%
  select(address, row, col, data_type, character, numeric) %>%
  head()
    ## # A tibble: 6 x 6
##   address   row   col data_type character                          numeric
##   <chr>   <int> <int> <chr>     <chr>                                <dbl>
## 1 A1          1     1 blank     <NA>                                    NA
## 2 B1          1     2 character State of New Hampshire - General …      NA
## 3 C1          1     3 blank     <NA>                                    NA
## 4 D1          1     4 blank     <NA>                                    NA
## 5 E1          1     5 blank     <NA>                                    NA
## 6 F1          1     6 blank     <NA>                                    NA

    Associate headers with cells

    cells = cells %>%
  filter(row > 2) %>%
  behead('W', 'precinct')

cells %>%
  filter(row > 4) %>%
  arrange(row, col) %>%
  select(address, row, col, character, numeric, precinct)
    ## # A tibble: 35 x 6
##    address   row   col character numeric precinct  
##    <chr>   <int> <int> <chr>       <dbl> <chr>     
##  1 B5          5     2 <NA>         2035 Allenstown
##  2 C5          5     3 <NA>            8 Allenstown
##  3 D5          5     4 <NA>         2013 Allenstown
##  4 E5          5     5 <NA>            3 Allenstown
##  5 F5          5     6 <NA>         1296 Allenstown
##  6 G5          5     7 <NA>          699 Allenstown
##  7 H5          5     8 <NA>            2 Allenstown
##  8 B6          6     2 <NA>         1310 Andover   
##  9 C6          6     3 <NA>            3 Andover   
## 10 D6          6     4 <NA>         1277 Andover   
## # ... with 25 more rows

    Associate headers with cells

    cells = cells %>%
  behead('NNW', 'office') %>%
  behead('N', 'candidate')

cells %>%
  arrange(row, col) %>%
  select(address, row, col, character, numeric, precinct, office, candidate)
    ## # A tibble: 35 x 8
##    address   row   col character numeric precinct   office    candidate   
##    <chr>   <int> <int> <chr>       <dbl> <chr>      <chr>     <chr>       
##  1 B5          5     2 <NA>         2035 Allenstown Sheriff   Hilliard, r…
##  2 C5          5     3 <NA>            8 Allenstown Sheriff   Scatter     
##  3 D5          5     4 <NA>         2013 Allenstown Attorney  Murray, r/d 
##  4 E5          5     5 <NA>            3 Allenstown Attorney  Scatter     
##  5 F5          5     6 <NA>         1296 Allenstown Treasurer " Hammond, …
##  6 G5          5     7 <NA>          699 Allenstown Treasurer Rodriguez, d
##  7 H5          5     8 <NA>            2 Allenstown Treasurer Scatter     
##  8 B6          6     2 <NA>         1310 Andover    Sheriff   Hilliard, r…
##  9 C6          6     3 <NA>            3 Andover    Sheriff   Scatter     
## 10 D6          6     4 <NA>         1277 Andover    Attorney  Murray, r/d 
## # ... with 25 more rows

    Finalize

    cells = cells %>%
  select(address, row, col, precinct, office, candidate, votes = numeric)

head(cells)
    ## # A tibble: 6 x 7
##   address   row   col precinct   office  candidate     votes
##   <chr>   <int> <int> <chr>      <chr>   <chr>         <dbl>
## 1 B5          5     2 Allenstown Sheriff Hilliard, r/d  2035
## 2 C5          5     3 Allenstown Sheriff Scatter           8
## 3 B6          6     2 Andover    Sheriff Hilliard, r/d  1310
## 4 C6          6     3 Andover    Sheriff Scatter           3
## 5 B7          7     2 Boscawen   Sheriff Hilliard, r/d  1661
## 6 C7          7     3 Boscawen   Sheriff Scatter          10

    Schema

    Field schema define our expectations about data:

    - name: votes
  title: Vote Count
  description: Number of votes received.
  source: Precinct returns for `jurisdiction`.
  type: integer
  constraints:
    required: true

    Representation in R

    data(fields, package = 'medslcleaner')
fields[['votes']]
    ## $name
## [1] "votes"
## 
## $title
## [1] "Vote Count"
## 
## $description
## [1] "Number of votes received."
## 
## $source
## [1] "Precinct returns for `jurisdiction`."
## 
## $type
## [1] "integer"
## 
## $constraints
## $constraints$required
## [1] TRUE

    Validation

    data(wyoming, package = 'medslcleaner')
wyoming %>%
  mutate(precinct = substr(precinct, 1, 10)) %>%
  select(state_postal, jurisdiction, precinct, office, candidate, writein, votes) %>%
  head()
    ##   state_postal jurisdiction   precinct   office candidate writein votes
## 1           WY       Albany Shields St US House      <NA>    TRUE     7
## 2           WY       Albany Albany Cou US House      <NA>    TRUE     5
## 3           WY       Albany Harmony Sc US House      <NA>    TRUE     2
## 4           WY       Albany Centennial US House      <NA>    TRUE     0
## 5           WY       Albany Rock River US House      <NA>    TRUE     1
## 6           WY       Albany Shields St US House      <NA>    TRUE     2

    Validation

    validate(wyoming)
## Validating:
##  ✔ year
##  ✔ state_postal
##  ✔ jurisdiction
##  ✔ precinct
##  ✔ office
##  ✔ district
##  ✔ stage
##  ✔ special
##  ✔ candidate
##  ✔ writein
##  ✔ party
##  ✔ mode
##  ✔ votes
##  ✔ dataverse
## Success!

    Validation

    returns = data.frame(votes = c(2, NA))
returns
    ##   votes
## 1     2
## 2    NA
    # validate_field(returns, 'votes')
#> Error: votes has missing values.

select_missing(returns, 'votes')
    ## 1/2 rows have missing "votes" values
    ##    votes
## 1:    NA

    Validation

    # validate(returns)
#> Error: .data does not have name year
